comments.content:
I think the sans is hand written -- the middle bar on the /E slides up and down and the /B is worse. The /R redefines its shape in each iteration.

Brand and identity, on the other hand appear to be built from Grand Hotel by Brian Bonislawsky.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725125605im_/http:/typophile.com/files/brand1_4126.jpg)
The sans happens to be PintassilgoPrints [Populaire](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725125605/http:/myfonts.us/td-Pdbm7v) playing with upper/lowercases to get different /R, /B, /K and so on.
